title: Market extends year-end rally
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) continued its positive momentum on Friday, with both key indices closing firmly in green territory, supported by higher trading volumes and improved turnover levels.

title: No explosives found so far at Kandy District Secretariat: Police
byline: Police said that no explosives have been found in search operations conducted so far at the Kandy District Secretariat, following information that bombs had been hidden within the premises.

title: CID arrests former Minister Douglas Devananda over missing firearm
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) arrested former Minister Douglas Devananda in connection with an investigation into a missing firearm.

title: Wijeya Newspapers Limited: Clarification on the Ne-Yo Concert
byline: Wijeya Newspapers Limited wishes to issue the following clarification regarding the Ne-Yo concert that was scheduled to take place on 28 December 2025 and has since been postponed.

title: Rains to enhance from December 29: Met. Department
byline: The rainy conditions are expected to enhance, particularly in the Northern, North-Central, Eastern, Uva and Central Provinces of the island in the next few days from December 29, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Former Malaysia PM Najib Razak found guilty in state funds scandal
byline: A Malaysia court has convicted former prime minister Najib Razak for abuse of power and money laundering, in his second major trial for a multi-billion-dollar state funds scandal.

title: Bomb threat reported at Kandy District Secretariat
byline: Kandy police said that people inside the District Secretariat in Kandy were evacuated today following a bomb threat.

title: Over 300 arrested for drunk driving on Christmas Day
byline: Police have arrested 322 drunk drivers during a special operation conducted yesterday.

title: Doctor drowns in Mirissa seas
byline: A 49-year-old doctor drowned while bathing in the seas off Mirissa beach, Police said.

title: Hands off independent media: Sajith tells government
byline:
Alleging that there is a move to suppress the independent media, Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa said today that all steps will be taken by his party to prevent such a move.

Alleging that there is a move to suppress the independent media, Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa said today that all steps will be taken by his party to prevent such a move.

title: Pope Leo urges ’courage’ to end Ukraine war in first Christmas address
byline: Pope Leo has urged Ukraine and Russia to find the ’’courage’’ to hold direct talks to end the war during his first Christmas remarks to crowds in St Peter’s square.

title: US launches strike against Islamic State militants in northwest Nigeria
byline: The United States carried out a strike against Islamic State militants in northwest Nigeria at the request of Nigeria’s government, U.S. President Donald Trump and the U.S. military said on Thursday, claiming the group had been targeting Christians in the region.

title: Two-minute silence to be observed today
byline: A two-minute silence will be observed today (26) in memory of those who lost their lives in the tsunami and other disasters, the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) said.

title: Suspect arrested in probe into murder of former Mulleriyawa PS Vice Chairman in 2022
byline: Police yesterday arrested a suspect wanted in connection with the shooting death of a former Vice Chairman of the Mulleriyawa Pradeshiya Sabha in Kotikawatta.

title: Hakgala Botanical Garden reopened for tourists
byline: The Hakgala National Botanical Garden, which was closed due to the Ditwah cyclone, has been reopened for tourists from today, the Ministry of Environment said.
